verse: I have ·seen [observed] something else ·wrong [evil] ·here on earth [under the sun; 1:3] that ·causes serious problems for [is frequent among] people.

God gives great wealth, ·riches [possessions], and honor to some people; they ·have everything [lack nothing] they want. But God does not let them ·enjoy such things [eat of it]; a stranger ·enjoys them instead [eats of it]. This is useless [1:2] and ·very wrong [a sickening evil].

A man might have a hundred children and live ·a long time [many years], but what good is it if he ·can’t enjoy the good God gives him [is not satisfied with the good things he has] or have a proper burial? I say a ·baby born dead [stillborn] is better off than he is.
A ·baby born dead [stillborn] is useless [1:2]. ·It returns to darkness without even a name [Its name is shrouded/obscured in darkness].
That baby never saw the sun and never knew ·anything [or the sun], but it finds more rest than that man.

Even if he lives ·two thousand years [a thousand years two times over], he doesn’t ·enjoy the good God gives him [experience good times]. ·Everyone is going [Do not all go…?] to the same place [the grave].

People have only a few useless [1:2] days of life on the earth; their ·short life [few days] passes like a shadow [1 Chr. 29:15; Ps. 144:4; Job 8:9; 14:12]. Who knows what is ·best [good] for them while they live? Who can tell them what ·the future will bring [will happen after them]?
